name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__LIST_CALENDARS
description: Get all the user's calendars. This retrieves calendars from the default calendar group and allows filtering, sorting, and selecting specific properties using OData query parameters.

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the calendar list

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response (e.g., 'id,name,color,owner')

$filter.description: Filter expression to limit calendars returned (e.g., 'canEdit eq true', 'owner/name eq "John Doe"')

$orderby.description: Property to sort calendars by with direction (e.g., 'name asc', 'createdDateTime desc')

$top.description: Maximum number of calendars to return

$skip.description: Number of calendars to skip for pagination

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__CREATE_CALENDAR
description: Create a new calendar for the user. This creates a calendar in the user's default calendar group with the specified name and optional properties like color.

body.description: The calendar properties for creating a new calendar

name.description: The name of the new calendar. This will be displayed in the calendar list.

color.description: The color theme for the calendar. Valid values include: lightBlue, lightGreen, lightOrange, lightGray, lightYellow, lightTeal, lightPink, lightBrown, lightRed, maxColor

hexColor.description: The hex color code for the calendar (e.g., '#FF5733'). If provided, this takes precedence over the color property.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__GET_CALENDAR
description: Get the properties and relationships of a specific calendar object by its ID. This retrieves detailed information about a calendar including permissions, settings, and metadata.

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar to retrieve

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the calendar details

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response (e.g., 'id,name,color,owner,canEdit')

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__UPDATE_CALENDAR
description: Update the properties of an existing calendar object. You can modify the calendar name, color theme, or default calendar status. Only include properties you want to update.

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar to update

body.description: The calendar properties to update. Only include fields you want to change.

name.description: The new name for the calendar. This will be displayed in the calendar list.

color.description: The color theme for the calendar. Valid values: lightBlue, lightGreen, lightOrange, lightGray, lightYellow, lightTeal, lightPink, lightBrown, lightRed, maxColor, auto

hexColor.description: The hex color code for the calendar (e.g., '#FF5733'). If provided, this takes precedence over the color property.

isDefaultCalendar.description: True if this calendar should be the user's default calendar, false otherwise. Note: Only one calendar can be the default.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__DELETE_CALENDAR
description: Delete a calendar other than the default calendar. This permanently removes the calendar and all its events. The default calendar cannot be deleted.

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar to delete. Note: Cannot delete the default calendar (isDefaultCalendar=true).

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__LIST_CALENDAR_VIEW
description: Get events, occurrences, exceptions and single instances from a calendar within a specified time range. This returns actual calendar events/appointments between the start and end dates.

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar to get events from

query.description: Query parameters for the calendar view. startDateTime and endDateTime are required.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the time range in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-01-15T09:00:00-08:00' or '2024-01-15T17:00:00Z')

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the time range in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-01-15T17:00:00-08:00' or '2024-01-16T01:00:00Z')

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include (e.g., 'id,subject,start,end,organizer'). Note: createdDateTime and lastModifiedDateTime don't support $select.

$filter.description: Filter expression to limit events (e.g., 'sensitivity eq normal', 'showAs eq busy')

$orderby.description: Property to sort events by (e.g., 'start/dateTime asc', 'subject desc')

$top.description: Maximum number of events to return (minimum 1, maximum 1000)

$skip.description: Number of events to skip for pagination

header.description: Optional request headers for customizing the response

Prefer.description: Use 'outlook.timezone="{timezone}"' to specify the timezone for start and end times in the response (e.g., 'outlook.timezone="Pacific Standard Time"' or 'outlook.timezone="America/New_York"'). If not specified, times are returned in UTC.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__LIST_EVENTS
description: Retrieve a list of all events in a calendar without date restrictions. This returns single instance meetings, series masters, and recurring events. Use this to get all events in a calendar regardless of time range.

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar to get events from

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the event list

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include (e.g., 'id,subject,start,end,organizer,location')

$filter.description: Filter expression to limit events (e.g., 'startsWith(subject,"Meeting")', 'sensitivity eq normal', 'showAs eq busy')

$orderby.description: Property to sort events by (e.g., 'start/dateTime asc', 'subject desc', 'createdDateTime desc')

$top.description: Maximum number of events to return

$skip.description: Number of events to skip for pagination

header.description: Optional request headers for customizing the response

Prefer.description: Use 'outlook.timezone="{timezone}"' to specify the timezone for start and end times in the response (e.g., 'outlook.timezone="Pacific Standard Time"' or 'outlook.timezone="America/New_York"'). If not specified, times are returned in UTC.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__CREATE_EVENT
description: Create a new event in a calendar. This allows creating meetings, appointments, and events with attendees, locations, recurrence patterns, and online meeting details.

calendar_id.description: The unique identifier of the calendar to create the event in

content.description: The content of the event description

dateTime.description: Start date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-04-04T14:00:00')
End date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-04-04T15:00:00')

displayName.description: Location display name (e.g., 'Conference Room A', 'Microsoft Teams', '123 Main St')

type.description: Type of attendee (required, optional, or resource)

isAllDay.description: Whether this is an all-day event

showAs.description: Show availability as (free, tentative, busy, oof, workingElsewhere)

reminderMinutesBeforeStart.description: Minutes before start to show reminder (e.g., 15, 30, 60)

isReminderOn.description: Whether to show a reminder for this event

categories.description: List of category names for the event

isOnlineMeeting.description: Whether this is an online meeting

allowNewTimeProposals.description: Whether attendees can propose new times

responseRequested.description: Whether to request responses from attendees

daysOfWeek.description: Days of the week for weekly patterns

endDate.description: End date in YYYY-MM-DD format (for endDate type)

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__GET_SCHEDULE
description: Get the free/busy availability information for a collection of users, distribution lists, or resources (rooms or equipment) for a specified time period. Perfect for finding available meeting times and checking when people are free.

schedules.description: Collection of SMTP email addresses of users, distribution lists, or resources to get availability information for

startTime.description: The date, time, and time zone that the period starts

dateTime.description: Start date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-06-21T09:00:00')

endTime.description: The date, time, and time zone that the period ends

dateTime.description: End date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-06-21T17:00:00')

availabilityViewInterval.description: Duration of a time slot in minutes for the availability view. Default is 30 minutes, minimum is 5, maximum is 1440 (24 hours)

header.description: Optional request headers for customizing the response

Prefer.description: Use 'outlook.timezone="{timezone}"' to specify the timezone for free/busy times in the response (e.g., 'outlook.timezone="Pacific Standard Time"' or 'outlook.timezone="America/New_York"'). If not specified, times are returned in UTC.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__LIST_ALL_EVENTS
description: Get a comprehensive list of all event objects across all calendars in the user's mailbox. This provides a unified view of all events from every calendar, supporting timezone preferences and OData query parameters for filtering, sorting, and pagination. Complements the specific calendar LIST_EVENTS function.

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the event list

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include (e.g., 'subject,start,end,organizer,attendees,location,body,bodyPreview')

$filter.description: Filter expression to limit events (e.g., 'startsWith(subject,"Meeting")', 'sensitivity eq normal', 'showAs eq busy'). Note: Cannot filter on recurrence property.

$orderby.description: Property to sort events by (e.g., 'start/dateTime asc', 'subject desc', 'createdDateTime desc')

$top.description: Maximum number of events to return

$skip.description: Number of events to skip for pagination

header.description: Optional request headers for customizing the response

Prefer.description: Use 'outlook.timezone="{timezone}"' to specify the timezone for start and end times in the response (e.g., 'outlook.timezone="Pacific Standard Time"' or 'outlook.timezone="America/New_York"'). If not specified, times are returned in UTC.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__CREATE_EVENT_DEFAULT
description: Create an event in the user's default calendar with simplified parameters. Perfect for quick event creation without specifying a calendar ID. Supports all event features including attendees, locations, recurrence patterns, and online meeting details.

body.description: Event details to create in the default calendar

content.description: The content of the event description

dateTime.description: Start date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-04-04T14:00:00')
End date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-04-04T15:00:00')

displayName.description: Location display name (e.g., 'Conference Room A', 'Microsoft Teams', '123 Main St')

locationEmailAddress.description: Email address for room or resource (if the location has an email address)

attendees.description: List of event attendees (including resources like meeting rooms or equipment)

address.description: Email address of the attendee or resource

name.description: Display name of the attendee or resource

type.description: Type: 'required' for essential attendees, 'optional' for non-essential, 'resource' for rooms/equipment

isAllDay.description: Whether this is an all-day event

showAs.description: Show availability as (free, tentative, busy, oof, workingElsewhere)

reminderMinutesBeforeStart.description: Minutes before start to show reminder (e.g., 15, 30, 60)

isReminderOn.description: Whether to show a reminder for this event

categories.description: List of category names for the event

isOnlineMeeting.description: Whether this is an online meeting

allowNewTimeProposals.description: Whether attendees can propose new times (default: true)

responseRequested.description: Whether to request responses from attendees

recurrence.description: The recurrence pattern for the event

interval.description: The number of units between occurrences

month.description: The month in which the event occurs

dayOfMonth.description: The day of the month on which the event occurs

daysOfWeek.description: Days of the week on which the event occurs

firstDayOfWeek.description: The first day of the week

index.description: Specifies on which instance of the allowed days specified in daysOfWeek the event occurs

startDate.description: The date to start applying the recurrence pattern

endDate.description: The date to stop applying the recurrence pattern

numberOfOccurrences.description: The number of times to repeat the event

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__GET_EVENT
description: Get the properties and relationships of a specific event. Returns event details including subject, body, attendees, location, start/end times, and all other event properties. Supports timezone preferences and custom property selection.

path.description: Path parameters for the event request

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to retrieve

query.description: Query parameters for customizing the event response

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response (e.g., 'subject,body,start,end,attendees,location,organizer')

header.description: Optional request headers for customizing the response

Prefer.description: Use 'outlook.timezone="{timezone}"' to specify the timezone for start and end times in the response (e.g., 'outlook.timezone="Pacific Standard Time"' or 'outlook.timezone="America/New_York"'). If not specified, times are returned in UTC.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__UPDATE_EVENT
description: Update the properties of an existing event. Can modify subject, attendees, times, location, body, importance, reminders, online meeting settings, and other event properties. Use PATCH to update only specified fields while preserving others.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to update

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to update

body.description: Event properties to update. Only include fields you want to change.

subject.description: The text of the event's subject line

body.description: The body of the message associated with the event

contentType.description: The format of the content (text or html)

start.description: The start date, time, and time zone of the event

dateTime.description: A single point of time in a combined date and time representation ({date}T{time}; for example, 2017-08-29T04:00:00.0000000)

timeZone.description: Represents a time zone, for example, 'Pacific Standard Time'

end.description: The date, time, and time zone that the event ends

dateTime.description: A single point of time in a combined date and time representation ({date}T{time}; for example, 2017-08-29T04:00:00.0000000)

timeZone.description: Represents a time zone, for example, 'Pacific Standard Time'

attendees.description: The collection of attendees for the event

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity level of the event

showAs.description: The status to show during the event time

isAllDay.description: Set to true if the event lasts all day

isReminderOn.description: Set to true if an alert is set to remind the user of the event

reminderMinutesBeforeStart.description: The number of minutes before the event start time that the reminder alert occurs

isOnlineMeeting.description: True if this event has online meeting information, false otherwise

onlineMeetingProvider.description: Represents the online meeting service provider

responseRequested.description: Set to true if the sender would like a response when the event is accepted or declined

hideAttendees.description: When set to true, each attendee only sees themselves in the meeting request and meeting tracking list

categories.description: The categories associated with the event

recurrence.description: The recurrence pattern for the event

interval.description: The number of units between occurrences

month.description: The month in which the event occurs

dayOfMonth.description: The day of the month on which the event occurs

daysOfWeek.description: Days of the week on which the event occurs

firstDayOfWeek.description: The first day of the week

index.description: Specifies on which instance of the allowed days specified in daysOfWeek the event occurs

startDate.description: The date to start applying the recurrence pattern

endDate.description: The date to stop applying the recurrence pattern

numberOfOccurrences.description: The number of times to repeat the event

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__DELETE_EVENT
description: Delete a specific event from the calendar. If the event is a meeting, deleting it on the organizer's calendar sends a cancellation message to all attendees. This action cannot be undone.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to delete

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to delete

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__PERMANENT_DELETE_EVENT
description: Permanently delete an event and place it in the purges folder in the dumpster. Unlike regular delete, this action moves the event to a deeper deletion state that cannot be recovered by standard means. Email clients cannot access permanently deleted items.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to permanently delete

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to permanently delete

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__DELTA_EVENTS
description: Get a set of event resources that have been added, deleted, or updated in a calendarView (a range of events defined by start and end dates) of the user's primary calendar. Supports delta query for incremental sync.

query.description: Query parameters for delta sync. Specify startDateTime and endDateTime for the initial call. Use $deltatoken or $skiptoken for subsequent calls.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the time range in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-07-20T00:00:00Z')

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the time range in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-07-22T00:00:00Z')

$deltatoken.description: A state token returned in the @odata.deltaLink URL of the previous delta function call. Use for incremental sync.

$skiptoken.description: A state token returned in the @odata.nextLink URL of the previous delta function call. Use for pagination.

header.description: Optional request headers for customizing the response

Prefer.description: Use 'outlook.timezone="{timezone}"' to specify the timezone for start and end times in the response (e.g., 'outlook.timezone="Pacific Standard Time"' or 'outlook.timezone="America/New_York"'). If not specified, times are returned in UTC.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__FORWARD_EVENT
description: Forward a meeting event to new recipients. Allows the organizer or attendee to forward the meeting request, optionally including a comment. The new recipients will be added to the event and notified.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to forward

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to forward

body.description: Request body for forwarding the event.

Comment.description: A comment to include in the forward notification. Can be empty.

ToRecipients.description: The list of recipients to forward the event to.

Address.description: The email address of the recipient.

Name.description: The display name of the recipient.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__ACCEPT_EVENT
description: Accept the specified event in a user calendar. Optionally include a comment and choose whether to send a response to the organizer.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to accept

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to accept

body.description: Request body for accepting the event.

comment.description: Text included in the response. Optional.

sendResponse.description: true if a response is to be sent to the organizer; otherwise, false. Optional. Default is true.

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__TENTATIVELY_ACCEPT_EVENT
description: Tentatively accept the specified event in a user calendar. Optionally include a comment, propose a new time, and choose whether to send a response to the organizer.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to tentatively accept

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to tentatively accept

body.description: Request body for tentatively accepting the event.

comment.description: Text included in the response. Optional.

sendResponse.description: true if a response is to be sent to the organizer; otherwise, false. Optional. Default is true.

proposedNewTime.description: An alternate date/time proposed by an invitee for a meeting request to start and end. Valid only for events that allow new time proposals. Optional.

dateTime.description: Start date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-07-22T10:00:00')

timeZone.description: Time zone for the start time (e.g., 'UTC', 'Pacific Standard Time')

dateTime.description: End date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-07-22T11:00:00')

timeZone.description: Time zone for the end time (e.g., 'UTC', 'Pacific Standard Time')

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__DISMISS_REMINDER
description: Dismiss a reminder that has been triggered for an event in a user calendar.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to dismiss the reminder for

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to dismiss the reminder for

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__SNOOZE_REMINDER
description: Postpone a reminder for an event in a user calendar until a new time.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to snooze the reminder for

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event to snooze the reminder for

body.description: Request body for snoozing the reminder.

newReminderTime.description: The new date and time to trigger the reminder.

dateTime.description: The new reminder time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-07-21T09:00:00')

timeZone.description: The time zone for the new reminder time (e.g., 'UTC', 'Pacific Standard Time')

name: MICROSOFT_CALENDAR__LIST_INSTANCES
description: Get the instances (occurrences) of an event for a specified time range. If the event is a seriesMaster, returns the occurrences and exceptions in the range.

path.description: Path parameters for the event to get instances for

eventId.description: The unique identifier of the event (series master or single event)

query.description: Query parameters for the time range and OData options.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the time range in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-07-20T00:00:00Z')

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the time range in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2025-07-22T00:00:00Z')

$select.description: Comma-separated list of properties to include in the response (e.g., 'subject,start,end,recurrence,type')

$top.description: Maximum number of instances to return

$skip.description: Number of instances to skip for pagination

$orderby.description: Property to sort instances by (e.g., 'start/dateTime asc')
